definition: echo/sound/noise/to make a sound/to sound/to ring/loud/classifier for noises
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: Often when one listens to a symphonic concert on the radio.
sentences.chinese: 當一個人從收音機中聽交響音樂會時。

sentences.english: Shanghai Symphony has been endeavoring to promote Chinese music and is its most authoritative interpreter.
sentences.chinese: 樂團力推中國作品，是中國交響音樂最權威的詮釋者。

sentences.english: Zheng Xiaoying has performed more than1000 opera and symphonic concerts.
sentences.chinese: 鄭小瑛指揮過超過1000場的歌劇和交響音樂會。

sentences.english: Zheng Xiaoying has performed more than 1000 opera and symphonic concerts.
sentences.chinese: 鄭小瑛指揮過超過1000場的歌劇和交響音樂會。

sentences.english: There was a symphony concert at the Music Hall.
sentences.chinese: 在女王音樂廳有一個交響音樂會。

sentences.english: A symphony concert will debut in the Water Cube during the National Day holiday.
sentences.chinese: 例句十一時期，水立方將舉行交響音樂會的首演。

sentences.english: We all like listening to orchestral music.
sentences.chinese: 我們都喜歡聽交響音樂。

sentences.english: She sang in Bach's Matthew's Passion at Symphony Hall in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 她曾在日本交響音樂廳演唱巴赫《聖馬太受難曲》。

sentences.english: At a symphony concert the musicians play their instruments under the direction of a conductor.
sentences.chinese: 交響音樂會的樂師們按照指揮的指令演奏樂器。
